title: Bo Bichette Joins Mets on Three Year
snippets: Inter Miami is prepared to pay the $15 million release clause for Monterrey forward Germán Berterame, sources told ESPN.

After missing out on Kyle Tucker, the Mets have agreed to a three-year, $126 million contract with Bo Bichette, sources confirmed to ESPN. New York plans to play Bichette at third base for the first time in his pro career.

Bo Bichette has found a new home. The longtime Toronto Blue Jays infielder has agreed to join the New York Mets on a three-year deal, The Athletic’s Will Sammon reported on Friday. The Athletic’s Ken Rosenthal reports the deal is for $126 million over the three years, with opt-outs after years one and two. The deal also includes a $5 million opt-out bonus and a full no-trade clause, per the New York Post’s Jon Heyman . After playing almost exclusively shortstop with the Blue Jays, Bichette is expected to play third base with the Mets, MLB Network’s Jon Morosi reported. The Phillies, who met...
